properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 5 at 3:16PM PST until January 7 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MORE MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE
CASCADES...NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...
AND THE IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.One round of snow will occur through tonight for the Cascades and
Idaho Panhandle with moderate accumulations near the Cascade
crest. A stronger storm arrives Monday with snow expanding to
include many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho with
moderate to heavy snow accumulations expected.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Mountain snow accumulations 1 to 2
feet. Valley snow accumulations 4 to 7 inches except 1 to 3
inches Silver Valley. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport,
Schweitzer Mountain Road, Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace,
Mullan, Fourth of July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass.

* WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to 6 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel is expected to become very difficult especially
in the mountains. The hazardous conditions could impact the
morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to change to rain Monday
afternoon in the Silver Valley and Monday evening over the
northern Panhandle valleys. Moderate to heavy mountain snow is
expected to continue at times Tuesday into Wednesday morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM PST TUESDAY
